aboutPreview.title: About Me
aboutPreview.text: I'm a clinical psychologist with experience in individual, couples, and family support. Training as a systemic-relational psychotherapist, I pay particular attention to each person and their individual and relational resources.

about.title: Ida Sato
about.subtitle: Clinical Psychologist — Order of Psychologists of Veneto, no. 13939
about.bio: Clinical psychologist with experience in individual, couples, and family support, as well as group facilitation and psychological interventions for children and parents. Training as a systemic-relational psychotherapist at the Centro Padovano di Terapia della Famiglia, I pay particular attention to the person, their relational system, and the therapeutic relationship, valuing individual and relational resources.

approach.title: My approach
approach.text: My work is based on the systemic-relational approach: every person is part of a system of relationships that influences their well-being. Together we explore relational dynamics and the resources present in your life context, to find new balances and possibilities for change. Each path is unique and is built together, respecting your timing and needs.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Answers to the most common questions about psychological counseling.

q1.question: How does the first consultation work?
q1.answer: The first consultation is an introductory meeting of about 50 minutes where we discuss your needs and the goals you'd like to achieve. It's a moment to get to know each other and understand together if the path I propose is right for you. It involves no commitment.

q2.question: How long is a session?
q2.answer: Each session lasts about 50 minutes. The frequency of meetings is agreed upon together based on individual needs, generally on a weekly or bi-weekly basis.

q3.question: What is the cost of sessions?
q3.answer: The cost of sessions is communicated during the initial consultation. Fees are in line with the Order of Psychologists guidelines and invoices are tax-deductible.

q4.question: Are online sessions available?
q4.answer: Yes, I offer the possibility of online sessions via video call. Remote sessions are equally effective and allow you to continue your path even when you cannot come to the office.

q5.question: How can I book an appointment?
q5.answer: You can contact me through the form on the Contact page, via email, phone, or WhatsApp. I'll get back to you as soon as possible to schedule an initial meeting.

q6.question: Are sessions confidential?
q6.answer: Absolutely. Professional secrecy is a fundamental ethical obligation. Everything shared during sessions is strictly confidential.

q7.question: What is the difference between a psychologist and a psychotherapist?
q7.answer: A psychologist holds a master's degree in psychology and is registered with the professional board. They can provide consultations, psychological support, and assessments. A psychotherapist has also completed a four-year specialization school that qualifies them to treat more structured psychological disorders.

q8.question: How do I know if I need psychological support?
q8.answer: If you feel that certain emotional, relational, or behavioral difficulties are interfering with your daily life, work, or relationships, it might be time to seek help. You don't need to wait until things get really bad — even talking to someone during a period of change can be helpful.

q9.question: Are sessions tax-deductible?
q9.answer: Yes. Psychological services are tax-deductible healthcare expenses in Italy (19% deduction on the amount exceeding the €129.11 threshold). I issue regular invoices.

howItWorks.title: How a psychological journey works
howItWorks.subtitle: If you've never been to a psychologist, it's normal to have questions or feel a bit anxious. Here's what to expect, step by step.

contact.title: First contact
contact.text: Write or call me to schedule an initial consultation. You can use the contact form, email, phone, or WhatsApp. I'll get back to you as soon as possible.

firstSession.title: The first session
firstSession.text: It's a meeting of about 50 minutes where we get to know each other. You tell me what brings you here, and I explain how I work. There's no obligation to continue — it's a moment to understand together if the path is right for you.

path.title: The therapeutic path
path.text: If we decide to continue, we define goals and meeting frequency together (usually weekly or bi-weekly). Each path is unique and tailored to you, respecting your timing.

modalities.title: Session modalities
modalities.subtitle: You can choose the modality that works best for you, based on your needs.

inPerson.title: In person
inPerson.text: I see clients at my offices in Meledo (VI) and Spinea (VE). A welcoming and private environment, designed to make you feel comfortable.

online.title: Online
online.text: Online sessions take place via video call, with the same quality and confidentiality as in-office sessions. Ideal if you have difficulty traveling or prefer the comfort of home.
